tweets.text: In sadder news ..the @EnvAgency have started destruction of all hedges behind the flood bank. where we see whitethroats, Lesser Whitethroats, Linnets, just up from where the firecrest was. So called ‚Äòmitigation‚Äô is planned but you can‚Äôt replace this. So depressing. New Passage. https://t.co/QM3JTRA3iU

#StormChristoph made it an extremely busy day for all yesterday, including our Operational Assurance Training Team, with a number of them deployed to the floods in Northwich. The rest remained at our training centre with our trainee firefighters to continues their recruit course. https://t.co/9MfeKDNKPF

tweets.text:
Levels here in #Shrewsbury about to peak  https://t.co/5AefZ3ciyW 
25 Feb 2020 level was 5.12m
My @EnvAgencyMids colleagues are working around the clock alongside partners operating flood defences in very challenging times.
Stay vigilant #StaySafe be #Floodaware https://t.co/S0X6zJtWu1

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: There is a large multiagency response, including ourselves, @NYorksPolice, @NorthYorksFire, @RyedaleDC and @EnvAgencyYNE taking place in #Malton to pump water safely into the #RiverDerwent. https://t.co/V2vuPyplG5
@raymoulds @EnvAgency Yep it does as per this (some suffer from risk from both) - you get one more Q before you reach your limit ;) https://t.co/OuTlCF5zWA

Extremely important advice from @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd - please take note, and please take care.

#PrepareActSurvive #TeamEA https://t.co/8hXGOE4O4m

A big shout out to anyone involved in managing effects of #StormChristoph. Assessing latest data, running models, making forecasts, issuing warnings, checking defences, keep trains and roads safe, planning rest centres. Thank You. @TheEPS1 @FloodForecasts @EnvAgency @metoffice

We continue to work with partners on a major pumping operation to alleviate flooding in #Malton from surface and groundwater.

We are also monitoring levels on the #RiverDerwent which is due to peak in the early hours of the morning below the flood defence level. https://t.co/JqOt3b6KmD
#Bewdley #Severn high flows, barrier doing its job @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency https://t.co/wsh0I5Bwdy

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
In the aftermath of #StormChristoph, some rivers in England continue to be at risk of flooding. 

Stay safe at home. If you need to go outside, be alert to the hidden dangers of flood water and check the flood risk in your area: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/oc02mOpfVK

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency‚Äôs flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here‚Äôs a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk
@raymoulds @EnvAgency Yep Ray all sources JC

In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

tweets.text: @johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Curious to know if those numbers include pluvial flooding as well as fluvial John. ?

#StormChristoph - as the rain passes here is the latest on flood impacts we‚Äôve seen - we‚Äôre still are in response mode so these numbers will change. Sadly 400 flooded but over 27500 protected. I attach comparison with recent / major floods in England to help calibrate. https://t.co/Df19TtMytY
@seabrkei @EnvAgencyYNE Hi Keith, yes it has apparently - https://t.co/gvFlMthflE

@BorisJohnson @EnvAgency BREAKING: The reproduction number, or R value, of coronavirus transmission has fallen and is now estimated to be between 0.8 and 1 across the UK, according to the Government Office for Science and the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies said.

Keep updated on warning status: https://t.co/xz679Jwi9G https://t.co/fkFjTPBN10

Some photos of our fantastic speakers at Wednesdays webinar! @EnvAgency @StJohnsOx @hollychubb It was really inspiring to hear all the different career paths geomorphologists can take! Sign up using the link below to join our next webinar... https://t.co/gpKP7hBley

(2 of 2) ... This driver will be interviewed in due course once sober. 

TYVM to @NorthYorksFire and @HighwaysYORKS for their assistance and dealing with the fuel spillage @EnvAgencyYNE 

#Fatal4 #DontDrinkAndDrive #RoadSafety #RoadsPolicing https://t.co/gU2P0FaOOQ

We spoke to @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd about the simple steps you can take to protect yourself from flooding.

Sign up for flood alerts here: https://t.co/KuIjpLKutU https://t.co/YKXL8pGzxf

Flood warnings remain in force across England, with many rivers at dangerously high levels. Don't take any unnecessary risks. Check the flood risk in your area: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9 

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/HPqCxfG0u6

Ecosystems services water storage and flood mitigation using the natural flood plain @EnvAgency funded work planned and implemented by @WiganCouncil in partnership with @Lancswildlife https://t.co/XGuz5PDA37

The #ClimateEmergency is bringing more flood, droughts, heatwaves and other extremes. Earlier this week, I gave a speech about locally-led #climatechange adaptation: https://t.co/6BMx0aMnPS Next week is @CASsummit2021, a key moment to accelerate climate #resilience globally. https://t.co/wBgtx7qK9B

tweets.text: @Cambs_Traffic @CambsCC @EnvAgency Much appreciated, yes please to any updates!

Often after #UKfloods, people say 'rivers need to be cleared'. Actually, no, rivers *need* obstructions to hold back water and #slowtheflow to reduce #flooding downstream. Putting more #leakydams in will help (or more #beavers!) @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust @BBCWinterwatch https://t.co/ZdYqbjqnxR

urls.title: Derby City Council logo
urls.description: With recent flood alerts, and some continued surface water causing disruption across the city, we‚Äô re answering your questions about Derby‚Äôs flood defences. The Our City Our River (OCOR) project was developed to reduce flood risk in Derby, and create a high-quality riverside, linking the city centre with the river. Flood gates and walls work by containing flood water in an engineered corridor through the city. The defences are designed to accommodate a certain siz e flood event. The Our City Our River
